channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: On private call, Arizona’s top Democrats debated a ‘dire’ ballot dilemma
item.description: The three state officials learned a computer glitch meant 98,000 voters had not provided proof of citizenship. In a candid phone call, they debated wh...

item.title: No Matter Who Writes the Check, U.S. Taxpayers Bear the Burden of Illegal Immigration
item.description: Mass immigration advocates have what they think is a nifty new idea to deal with the soaring state and local cost of illegal immigration, now estimate...

item.title: California Illegal Aliens May Get to Push #1 for a Phone Subsidy
item.description: For years mass immigration advocates have rejected any meaningful distinction in status between illegal aliens and legal immigrants. As such, many sta...

item.title: DHS Inspector General Releases Report on CBP One App, Highlights Mismanagement
item.description: On August 19, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Office of the Inspector General (OIG) released a report critiquing the CBP One mobile app. To ...

item.title: Fed moves to protect weakening job market with bold rate cut
item.description: The move signals that the central bank is growing nervous about the declining labor market.

item.title: Report Says Illegal Aliens Responsible for Up to 75% of Violent Crime Arrests in Midtown Manhattan
item.description: New York City is in the midst of a violent migrant crime wave. According to a recent report by the New York Post, illegal aliens account for up to 75 ...

item.title: Harris dismisses Trump as ‘not serious’ on the economy in MSNBC interview
item.description: It was her first solo interview with a national network as the Democratic presidential nominee.

item.title: Harris trolls Trump on second debate during Georgia-Alabama game
item.description: The campaign ran a television ad during the game to reach viewers in the key battleground state of Georgia.

item.title: Is Sweden Turning the Corner on Open Borders?
item.description: Sweden was once a poster child for open-borders advocates, and regularly made headlines for the social problems associated with those policies. Howeve...

item.title: Amazon Spared U.K. Antitrust Probe Over $4 Billion Investment in AI Startup Anthropic
item.description: The investment handed the U.S. tech company a minority ownership position in Anthropic as part of efforts to support AI startups it sees as promising.

item.title: Trump held rally in Wisconsin; Vance in Pennsylvania
item.description: Get the latest news from the 2024 campaign trail in the contest between Vice President Harris and former president Donald Trump.

item.title: Janet Yellen Defends Her Record – and Delivers a Warning
item.description: The Treasury secretary is defending her legacy — and warning that the stability of the U.S. economy is at stake.

item.title: Biden touts economic gains, acknowledges a long way to go
item.description: Interest rate cut "is not a declaration of victory, it’s a declaration of progress."

item.title: During the fundraiser in San Francisco, Kamala Harris discussed the importance of the election and declared...
Trump falsely attacks Harris as ‘mentally impaired’ and ‘mentally disabled,’ prompting criticism
item.description: The remarks drew a rebuke from a group that advocates for people with disabilities.

item.title: Joe Biden preps to sell the economy — to boost his legacy and help Harris
item.description: Biden is determined to convince a skeptical public that he strengthened the economy.

item.title: Touch Screens Are Over. Even Apple Is Bringing Back Buttons.
item.description: Product designers are embracing how users actually feel after years of pushing flat and sleek

item.title: Apple's New Password Manager Is Free. That's Just One Reason to Use It.
item.description: Your Apple-saved passwords are now in one, easy-to-access place.

item.title: Apple Is No Longer in Talks to Join OpenAI Investment Round
item.description: The company behind ChatGPT is aiming to raise around $6.5 billion in a funding round set to close next week.

item.title: OpenAI's Complex Path to Becoming a For-Profit Company
item.description: Converting from a nonprofit happens rarely, especially for organizations this wealthy. OpenAI has two years to do so.
